title: MANUAL CONTROL lost message on param set (and save)
body: Every time QGC sends a param value to Pixracer, I get the message "MANUAL CONTROL lost". Presumably something is blocking the manual control timeout check.

title: 4001_quad_x: use PWM_DISARMED param
body: Without this, setting the param `PWM_DISARMED` doesn't have any effect.

title: Check navigator polling
body:
It looks like the navigator is not doing orb_copy for vehicle_command after the poll.

Found by @simonegu.

title: DriverFramework: update submodule
body:
This fixes a gyro/accel scaling bug on Snapdragon.

Bench tested on Snapdragon by me and @ericye16.

SITL broken

title: Check Pixracer ESC calibration
body:
After a [report on the mailinglist](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/px4users/V5lGnBgwY0Y) about, I tried to do an ESC calibration with Pixracer and found the following behaviour:
1. Calibration is started in QGC, battery plugged in is detected but the ESC doesn't beep for the calibration as it should.
2. After the calibration was done, the ESC starts beeping (probably because of no pulse) even though `pwm info` shows a disarmed pulse of 900us.

The results seemed to be the same with or without using the safety button before trying to calibrate.

I'll have to dig deeper with a scope soon.

title: FW position controller does not run without global position
body:
Ekf2 does not always publish global position. Since the fw position controller polls on the global position
it does not run in that case.

title: DF wrappers: apply calibration after rotation
body:
The calibration was applied wrongly for DriverFramework sensors that were not used with the default rotation.

Thanks to @eyeam3 for finding this (see: ae66085f89ea6197b2c469c63f9c6d5d70c62f3c).

FYI: @mayanez, @ericye16, @HidenoriKobayashi

title: Mixer loading corner case

milestone.title: Release v1.6.0
milestone.description: The main novelty of this release is a massive NuttX update adding support for STM32F7 and fault logging.

body:
If we try to load the following mixer it seems to get sent to IO but one of the last 2 mixers doesn't get loaded.

```
R: 2- 10000 10000 10000 0
Z:
M: 2
O:      10000  10000      0 -10000  10000
S: 1 0  10000  10000      0 -10000  10000
S: 1 1  10000  10000      0 -10000  10000
M: 2
O:       10000   10000    0 -10000  10000
S: 1 0   10000   10000    0 -10000  10000
S: 1 1  -10000  -10000    0 -10000  10000
```

It seems to split it up at a bad location during transfer. If I extend it a bit (add another null mixer before), or remove one of the minus signs in the first servo mixer, or change `PX4IO_P_CONFIG_MAX_TRANSFER` from 64 to 32, the mixer loads correctly.

title: EKF2 baro innovation variance jumps
body:
@priseborough @CarlOlsson I noticed in a recent log that the baro innovation variance looks fishy.
It seems to jump between two regimes. I'm not aware of the latest changes that went into the estimator but it could also be a logging issue.
I'll look at this as soon as possible but maybe you already have an idea.

![ekf2_innov_problem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7610489/17021216/d0c8558e-4f46-11e6-9001-45fe8aa2e28d.png)

The log is here http://logs.uaventure.com/view/uTTPh2WZuRtDc4SJcZ5V5e#Power_PLOT

title: GPS doesn't work on 1.4.1 master
body:
When I use latest code on branch master, GPS can't find any satellite.
When I use code on branch beta or stable, GPS works fine.
I tried with two GPS module, an u-blox M8N and an u-blox 7N.And the Hardware is pixhawk 2.4.6.

title: Drift when estimating attitude on Snapdragon eagle platform
body:
Hi,
I'm noticing drift / poor attitude estimation on the Snapdragon eagle platform. For example, if I flip the drone on its back, it takes a few seconds to settle and find the correct attitude. Similarly when I flip it back, the roll angle will be wrong by up to 45 degrees and only slowly correct. What parameters can I tune to fix this? I've already tried changing parameters in Attitude Q estimator via QGroundControl but these changes don't seem to affect it.
EDIT: it actually uses the ekf2 estimator on the qurt side despite SYS_MC_EST_GROUP. So ekf2 seems to be drifting.

title: load_mon stop fails and publish fails in simple test
Re-add RPi mainapp.config
body: Sadly, mainapp.config got swallowed by .gitignore. It's revived and `*.config` is removed from gitignore.

title: Fix landed and auto-disarm hysteresis
body:
This is an attempt to fix #5083.

The issue showed two cases where hysteresis was used wrongly. Both times, the timestamp was not updated correctly or consistently. I therefore went ahead and created a class which abstracts hysteresis away and replaced the two cases.

Please review and cross-test, thanks.

title: Auto-disarm in RTL reported
body:
There seems to be a scary bug where RTL caused all motors to stop immediately in flight.

More details in https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/px4users/UxPZQ6G4KVs.

title: setting active waypoint and mission feasibility checker
body:
If you change the active waypoint (MISSION_SET_CURRENT) the mission feasibility will check your current distance from the first waypoint and possibly refuse the mission.

![screenshot from 2016-07-15 20-05-32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/84712/16891461/c068348a-4ac7-11e6-8521-006293738bc4.png)

title: Fix gyro calibration
body:
The gyro calibration scale was initialized and set to 0 in a calibration instead of 1.

Tested using Pixhawk.

This fixes #5060 and #5029.

@bkueng please review and merge as soon as travis is ok.

title: Completely unstable MC flight v1.4.1rc2
body:
I had successful flight with tag v1.4.1rc1 logs [here](http://logs.uaventure.com/view/DzRQoowFfGX5HzUae966nJ#_PLOT) (intensive wind conditions)

But when I switched to tag v1.4.1rc2 or master (at today's commit eda2915f0b4706ddfbd6df9770ce237baa5c5ad9) I have following problems:
- I experience the same issue as her #5029.
- It get GPS 3d fix but doesn't go ALT hold, unless you put LPE_GPS_ON = 0
- a copter is completely unstable - barely hold the plane attitude indoor and falls down after few seconds outside with wind. Estimator - LPE, all the PIDs are the same as the were for excellent performance flights. Some falling logs: http://logs.uaventure.com/view/EQAsb8tZDSbbsrKTMDhZzB
  http://logs.uaventure.com/view/VPVTTbxNrf5TWXn7PLnHdD

title: Airspeed circuit breaker has no effect
body: I found today that the only way to arm Pixhawk in fixedwing mode was with an airspeed sensor connected. The circuit breaker didn't seem to have any effect.

title: Allow POSCTL with local position
body:
We want to allow flying POSCTL with optical flow only without GPS.

This should resolve:
https://github.com/PX4/snap_cam/issues/10
https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/issues/4929
https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/issues/4962

I can't test this because I don't have a working flow setup. I tried to use `make posix gazebo_iris_opt_flow` but it didn't report any optical flow. @ChristophTobler Am I doing something wrong?

title: Fix multirotor override
body:
While testing the in-air restart functionality of Pixhawk as part of #996, I realized that manual RC override was active for multirotors during the time that FMU is down. 

I traced it down to wrong if conditions for override mode inside px4iofirmware.

@bkueng and @LorenzMeier please review commit by commit, otherwise it's too much to grasp with all the ifs and bools.

This has been bench tested using a quad and delta wing configuration. Override is working for fixedwing (always, even when FMU is ok) and motors are shutting down correctly in multrotor mode.

body:
Hi,

title: Improve preflight check reporting
body:
This should enhance the reporting for preflight check failures and resolve #4695. 

Bench tested on Pixhawk.

title: Snapdragon: Fix sdlog2 update misses
body:
sdlog2 sometimes missed samples on Snapdragon. This is not the usual drops because of file IO but rather the poll loop doesn't keep up and misses a sample.

The drops still happens with the fixes in this PR every few minutes but generally a lot less frequent than earlier.

The fixes are regression tested on Pixhawk for both normal and replay logging.

FYI: @LorenzMeier, @bkueng

title: ekf2: don't ignore function argument
body: This looks like a bug but the function was never actually wrongly used.

title: tailsitter - an extra minus in the ROLL
body:
In vtol->tailsitter, in FIXED_WING (and back transition) the roll elevon signal is inverted.
According to [LorenzMeier](http://discuss.px4.io/t/why-the-roll-elevon-is-inverted/622) this inversion should me moved somewhere (I guess in the mixer, in the text file which defines the mixing rules): 

> That's something that has crept in and will be refactored.

title: px4flow testing, position control failed under I-NAV in v1.4.0 and above
body:
Hello
I am testing px4flow (no GPS) on pixhawk which running I-NAV.It can be switched to posctl successfully(not ARMED).But after it was armed,when i changed to position control, the light turned to green and then to pink(purple?),and failed to hover.
Firmware version: v1.3.3, v1.4.0rc2,also tested in latest 1.4.0rc3, all failed.

As a comparason, iNAV works without any problem using firmware v1.3.0/v1.3.1 or earlier. So anyting changed?

title: jMAVSim: mavlink_receiver.cpp:publish  hil_sensors combine but can not receive!
use MC auto rates only (but always) in AUTO
body: I had a weird issue during the VTOL transition where we disable velocity control in missions. The rate limits suddenly changed, this fix makes sure the auto rate settings always apply in auto, only for auto. Meaning also it changes the behaviour for POSCTL, it will use the manual rate limits. Might that be a problem?

title: Removed duplicate rate constraint
body:
@tumbili too much weathervaning for me ;)
Did I miss something or is this really just duplicated?

title: FW vtol landing always forced
body: VTOL land was being forced for FW.

title: FW takeoff mode doesn't work

milestone.title: Release v1.6.0
milestone.description: The main novelty of this release is a massive NuttX update adding support for STM32F7 and fault logging.

body:
In SITL gazebo plane if you select takeoff mode it accepts the takeoff setpoint immediately and takes off directly in loiter.

https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/pull/4932

title: sitl gazebo plane fix land detector startup order
body:
In gazebo plane takeoff (from guided mode) was going directly into a loiter without gaining any altitude.

fw_pos_control_l1 didn't have the correct vehicle landed state because the land detector was started first which meant it never updated within fw_pos_control_l1 prior to takeoff.

title: Unable to use pos control when not using GPS
body:
A new commit has broken the ability to utilize position control nav state when gps_failure flag is true. This should probably be checking for valid_lpos or valid_gpos flags instead of only checking for gps_failure.

https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/blob/8a12dee125c37a3e48104877efd0f109d90b039b/src/modules/commander/state_machine_helper.cpp#L674

title: Pr fw wing rock
body:
1) Should solve the wing rock problem here #4523 
2) Shifts the computation of the complete attitude setpoint except for the full manual mode (attitude setpoint is published by fw_att_control) into the fw position controller.
This ensures that the setpoint is logged correctly including the setpoint offsets which were never included in the logged data.
3) As mentioned in 2) the attitude setpoint offsets are now added just before the attitude setpoint is published.

TODO:
- [x] SITL test

title: Snapdragon: replay log has drops
body: Recent flight testing with Snappy yielded replay logs with drops/timeouts. As far as I know this was working (better) before and therefore needs git bisecting.

title: Position control with large yaw errors
body:
@tumbili is it possible that we throw the velocity controller off with rotating the attitude setpoint to actual yaw? Lost it in position control twice when the yaw error got large. The system is also on its limits when it happens so saturation plays in as well.

The effect is observable right before I switch our of POSCTL:
http://logs.uaventure.com/view/WmMtyfDAmhmDDKr5nQt9qf
http://logs.uaventure.com/view/HPRbSQ3RhAuHfPfNBpabGM

title: allow yaw setpoint offset to be reduced once maxed out
body: @tumbili could you check this? If you get into yaw saturation currently the setpoint will stay where it is and you cannot yaw back anymore. Happens quite easily with our Fun Cub in wind.

title: data link loss fail-safe do not work in POSCTL/ALTHOLD
body:
In QGC, NAV_DLL_ACT has several value option: loiter, RTL, land at current position. But modules/commander/commander.cpp only care about if NAV_DLL_ACT(datalink_loss_enabled) > 0

And NAV_DLL_ACT do not work in most modes except MAIN_STATE_AUTO_MISSION
according to set_nav_state() in  modules/commander/state_machine_helper.cpp
only when internal_state->main_state == MAIN_STATE_AUTO_MISSION, it will handle data_link_loss_enabled
in other modes like MAIN_STATE_POSCTL or MAIN_STATE_ALTCTL, it do not handle data_link_loss_enabled

title: FW: Cannot takeoff in mission mode anymore
body:
In mission mode the prop should start spinning and rev up once takeoff is detected.
This did not work anymore with the last stable release of QGC on the tablet.

title: MissionCheck.py can't connect
body:
@sanderux I've started looking at putting SITL MissionCheck in the builds, but so far I've been unable to connect. Is this still working for you?

```
dronekit.APIException: Timeout in initializing connection.
```

title: make px4fmu-v2_ekf2 broken on master
body:
I'm trying to flash a PixFalcon with PX4 master (bada390ddebb65562cb306fa0c98ee78ee5e3446). I want to use EKF2 so I do

```
make px4fmu-v2_ekf2 upload
```

The code compiles without issues and appears to successfully erase/program/upload.
After rebooting, the welcome tune sounds but QGC can't connect to it (connected via USB). I see the message

```
Your Vehicle is not responding. If this continues shutdown QGroundControl, restart the
Vehicle letting it boot completely, then start QGroundControl.
```

This does not help, however.

When flashing with

```
make px4fmu-v2_default upload
```

QGC connects as expected.

title: SITL connection problem when running simulator in custom udp port
body:
This bug affects both sitl_run.sh and sitl_multiple_run.sh.

If I edit the file "rcS_gazebo_iris" changing "simulator start -s" with "simulator start -s -u 15000" and run "roslaunch px4 mavros_posix_sitl.launch" I get no connection for mavros. However it works fine without changing the file.

The problem with this is that the relatively new way of launching multiple SITL instances use this variant of running different simulators in custom ports and I can't get a connection with them either.

I tried to figure out where is that port harcoded but I couldn't find it. I thought it was a bug in the way of setting the value of the port but checking the log I saw this message: "INFO  [simulator] Waiting for initial data on UDP port 15000. Please start the flight simulator to proceed.." so that is working fine.

title: Startup problem after Firmware 1.3.2 update
body:
Hi
today I updated my firmware to 1.3.2. I used the source code, followed the guide http://dev.px4.io/starting-building.html and successfully built the project. After successful upload, my px4 got stuck somehow. 
Serial output yields the following:

**_sercon: Registering CDC/ACM serial driver

the red light of the arming button is blinking but it never stops. The big LED on the px4 never comes to light. Am I doing something wrong or is there an issue with the newest firmware release?

(Btw flashing the newest firmware via QGC works fine)

title: Low altitude take-off overshoot

milestone.title: Release v1.7.0
milestone.description: Maintenance release of the 1.7.0 release schedule.

body:
When doing auto missions with LPE I noticed this:
## Altitude spike at start of mission

Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t7s8027uKZ4

Log:
http://logs.uaventure.com/view/beRXQ3uES9ctPkv2H5ymDQ

I think it is related to the takeoff command, the z setpoint is not showing it, even though the climb does appear in agl, this is in MPC_ALT_MODE = 1 so the controller is tracking AGL.

``` python
pl.figure(figsize=(15,5))
(data.EST0_s7 - data.EST0_s2).plot(label='AGL, m')
(-1*data.LPSP_Z).plot()
data.STAT_MainState.plot()
pl.grid()
pl.legend(loc='best')
```

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/473772/16050956/b2ade754-322b-11e6-841d-ef55f1fec197.png)

title: SITL targets confusion
body:
Some of the SITL targets don't seem to be accessible to run anymore, e.g.

`make posix_sitl_lpe gazebo`

We should go through all of them and consolidate, fix them or clean it up.

title: BAT_V_SCALING and BAT_C_SCALING disappeared w/o ROMFS vehicle updates
body: I just tried to fly my 3dr iris on master, but the battery voltage is reading 10.2 when it should be 12.5 volts. I looked at the firmware on master and saw that all of the params set fot he battery in the iris ROMFS have now disappeared.

title: USB connection hangs on OS X El Capitan
body:
The app will hang during serial port open. This happens with QGC but has nothing to do with QGC. It can be reproduced with a simple C application (see QGC Issue) that just opens the serial port (or connecting with a terminal app). If you connect to the boot loader the serial port open will succeed. If you open the port after the main firmware is up and running it will hand for a minute or so and finally succeed.

Related QGC Issue: https://github.com/mavlink/qgroundcontrol/issues/3225

title: VTOL_LAND ignores altitude
body:
When setting a VTOL_LAND mission item the vehicle navigates to the waypoint, transitions and lands.
A common scenario would be to set this waypoint on a lower altitude to minimize the time required for descend. In the current setup however, the navigator does not take the altitude of this waypoint into account. I believe this was because the default altitude of this type of mission item was 0.

title: Magnetic field of JMAVSim not realistic in magnitude
body:
Something is wrong with the way JMAVSim generates the earth magnetic field vector.
The Z component of the field is way too large, e.g. 1.7ga.
EKF 3D mag fusion does not work well like this.

title: Change prefix construction to allow correct building of scope tag in …
body:
Change prefix construction to allow correct building of scope tag in parameters.xml when building out-of-tree

Fixes issue #4767

title: Revert "sitl_gazebo: update submodule"
body:
This reverts commit a9a0759d91209c8a8839feba62e58a90c3e00e6e.

Sorry, I jumped 2 commits instead of 1.

title: VTOL does not loiter if no WP after transition
Out of Tree Build Fails to Generate Initial/Default Parameters
body:
Building the px4/Firmware project out of the source tree generates a valid executable (successful boot) but a bad/incomplete romfs.  Using the following (assuming PX4_SRC_PATH and INSTALL_ROOT are different)

```
cmake $PX4_SRC_PATH -G "Unix Makefiles" -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=$INSTALL_ROOT -DCONFIG=nuttx_px4fmu-v4_default
make
```

When the resulting image is loaded on a pixracer the following console output (partial inline, full attached) is produced:

sercon: Registering CDC/ACM serial driver
sercon: Successfully registered the CDC/ACM serial driver
param: selected parameter default file /fs/mtd_params
rgbled: no RGB led on bus #1
blinkm: I2C init failed
blinkm: init failed
param: Error: Parameter SYS_AUTOCONFIG not found.
param: Error: Parameter SYS_USE_IO not found.
param: Error: Parameter INAV_LIDAR_ERR not found.
param: Error: Parameter SYS_AUTOSTART not found.
param: Error: Parameter SYS_AUTOSTART not found.
param: Error: Parameter SYS_AUTOSTART not found.
param: Error: Parameter SYS_AUTOSTART not found.
param: Error: Parameter SYS_AUTOSTART not found.

From these error messages there appears to be a problem generating the initial/default parameter setup for the image during the out-of-tree build.

Further the current build of QGroundControl 2.9.7b does allow the vehicle to be configured in this state and board reflash is required to recover.

[Full Console Log](https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/files/303724/boot-console.txt)

title: No throttle response in manual without position publication
body: We need to investigate further, but while testing LPE, if it wasn't publishing position due to waiting on a GPS signal for altitude initializatoin (LPE_GPS_ON) flag, the throttle of the vehicle would not respond even when in full manual control.

title: Fixes Function signature MPU9250
body:
Build was failing due to incorrect function signature for MPU9250 wrapper.

Related to https://github.com/PX4/DriverFramework/pull/102

title: param SYS_MC_EST_GROUP not available in px4fmu-v2_ekf2
body:
Once you have flashed px4fmu-v2_ekf2 on to Pixhawk, you can't actually change the param `SYS_MC_EST_GROUP` to `2` because the param can't be found.

The param should always get compiled in, not sure why this isn't the case.

title: SITL sending multiple MISSION_COUNT responses to MISSION_REQUEST_LIST
body:
Using daily QGC and master firmware:
1) Boot SITL
2) Boot QGC
3) QGC will send MISSION_REQUEST_LIST
4) SITL will send multiple MISSION_COUNT messages (item count=0 which is correct)

You can see this from QGC error messages or you can turn on MissionManagerLog to see as well the single request from QGC and the multiple MISSION_COUNT's coming back.

title: Fix SITL CPU
body:
Essentially contains https://github.com/PX4/DriverFramework/pull/87.

This lowers the CPU load of mainapp for SITL gazebo from 100% to 45% of one core.

Should help with #4656.

Something is not right with the sensor data.

title: Snapdragon: ekf2 doesn't init on field
The coordinate systems of snapdragon flight P1 and P2 boards are different.
body: I've already used 3DR GPS/MAG module as the external GPS/Mag. Today I find out if I rotate the GPS module, heading will not change on QGC, but if snapdragon flight is rotated, heading changes. SENS_EXT_MAG is set to "External is primary Mag" but seems didn't work. Besides, without GPS lock, heading will slowly turn at random directions. In a real flight this afternoon, I tested POSCTL and Stabilized flight mode, both will takeoff but in the same time spin around fast, just like I continuously give quadrotor a yaw control. In the bench test, I find out one the output PWM duty of the forth motor is lower then other motors though I just add little throttle, without roll, pitch or yaw control.

title: DriverFramework: update submodule
body:
This fixes a bug where the accelsim and gyrosim were conflicting with
work handles which lead to a state where no gyro data was published.

Fixes #4646 .

title: SITL not taking off
body:
SITL doesn't seem to be working anymore.

From my investigation, the sensors module is timing out because no gyro data is published.

The accelsim::_measure() call is stopped when this line happens:
https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/blob/master/src/platforms/posix/drivers/accelsim/accelsim.cpp#L1087

title: Fixed stack overflow in UAVCAN process
body:
Not sure when did this change, but the UAVCAN process now requires ~2100 bytes of stack instead of 1700 (tested with GCC 4.8 and 4.9). This changeset increases the UAVCAN stack to 2400 bytes, which fixes occasional crashes due to stack overflow.

At least f290650646e6b8feaec4e4e03c7b1d67f5100d95 should be cherry-picked into stable.

FYI @Aperture-Laboratories

title: Snapdragon: external 5883 not working
body: There seems to be another regression on the Snappy. The hmc5883 reports zeros.

title: sdlog2: fix Segfault on Eagle
body:
Since orb_exist doesn't work on the Snapdragon Linux side, we need to do
an additional orb_check after the orb_subscribe_multi, otherwise we copy
garbage.

The segfault was triggered by a count/length information about ESC
packets which lead to access outside the struct in the garbage case.

@LorenzMeier or @bkueng please review.

Fixes #4638.

title: Flaperons change neutral aileron PWM value
body: When enabling flaperons (spoilerons) and assigning them to aux 2 it works perfectly for auto landing. It's actually spot on. The problem is that it changes the centre pwm value from 1500 to 1420 for the ailerons. Tested multiple times, multiple type of servos and multiple versions of the firmware. If you mechanically centre your ailerons at 1500 pwm during setup it become an issue because after the fact you need to reset them to be centered at 1420 and adjusting this by trim shouldn't be the fix. It's easy to recreate, just load up a plane with flaperon support (flaps, ailerons in the mixer) and don't assign the flaps or aux2 to a channel.. Ailerons will be centred at 1500. Open QGC and set aux2 and flaps to channel 9 and it will instantly change down to 1420. It's an easy mechanical fix but beyond being a bit of an annoyance, I can't seem to understand why it is occurring.

title: px4iofirmware: fixed a bug with override handling
body:
this fixes a race condition between the DMA completion handler
updating registers in px4io and the mixer used for handling the
override state. The register set code could set r_page_servos[]
between the time when pwm_limit_calc() is called and the servos are
actually output.

@kd0aij Could you test this on a fixed wing? In particular the switch between manual and stabilised.

title: px4fmu-v2_default - Channel mapping has no effect for AUX channel pass throught
body:
Channel mapping settled by qgroundcontrol has no effect for AUX channel pass through
AUX1 and AUX2 has fixed PWM
Other AUX channels are inactive

title: Standard VTOL pusher for pitch feature needs reconsideration
body:
Since we have changed the creation of manual control setpoints we need to adjust the code which
uses the pusher thrust to accelerate forward. It will now not properly work if yaw errors are becoming larger.

title: External Mag Rotation
body:
With a fresh pixhawk (all params reset) and an external mag there doesn't seem to be a way to set the rotation in QGC sensor calibration. Unless I've missed something it appears that you're only prompted for the rotation if CAL_MAGi_ID is set and CAL_MAGi_ROT >= 0 (external), but those aren't set until you calibrate.
https://github.com/mavlink/qgroundcontrol/blob/master/src/AutoPilotPlugins/PX4/SensorsComponent.qml#L109

One way to fix this would be filling in CAL_MAG*_ID in sensors. It gets a bit more complicated with the possibility of external mags coming and going and not wanting to throw away calibration until you have to.
https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/blob/master/src/modules/sensors/sensors.cpp#L1386

title: Descend mode when GPS fails needs checking
body:
The case where RC and GPS, both have failed, needs to be checked. It should go into open-loop descend mode, however, it doesn't seem to execute it correctly and just drifts off.

Additionally, it can't auto-disarm after landing because the landing detector doesn't work when GPS is lost.
